TopicTitle: You Know You're A Nerd When:

Articles.Content:
When you think different types of screws are interesting.

 

Edited August 27, 2023 by Ben J. Kerman
New page!

When you watch science videos from channels like Journey to the Microcosmos or machinists channels like Clickspring or This old Tony on youtube.

002308272023
When your TV is equipped with touchscreen, but you still use a laser pen to switch the channels.

When you watch Avengers: Infinity War and see the part with the "neutron star" and started saying things like "That's a neutron star?!? Why do all these movies always say 'neutron star' just to sound cooler or something?!?" "No! Neutron stars don't die, they're already dead!!!" "No! A space station can't orbit that thing!!! The gravity is too strong!!!" "NOOOOOOO!!! NEUTRON STARS DON'T JUST IGNITE AND BURN LIKE A REGULAR STAR!!! THEY'RE GOD DANG DEAD ALREADY OH MY GOD I CANNOT TAKE THIS!!!"

And then you start judging the station design. "Are you telling me all these people put this much effort into building a ring-shaped space station and didn't spin it up to generate centrifugal force for gravity? You may as well just make a dinky modular one then!"

41 minutes ago, TwoCalories said:

When you watch Avengers: Infinity War and see the part with the "neutron star" and started saying things like "That's a neutron star?!? Why do all these movies always say 'neutron star' just to sound cooler or something?!?" "No! Neutron stars don't die, they're already dead!!!" "No! A space station can't orbit that thing!!! The gravity is too strong!!!" "NOOOOOOO!!! NEUTRON STARS DON'T JUST IGNITE AND BURN LIKE A REGULAR STAR!!! THEY'RE GOD DANG DEAD ALREADY OH MY GOD I CANNOT TAKE THIS!!!"

And then you start judging the station design. "Are you telling me all these people put this much effort into building a ring-shaped space station and didn't spin it up to generate centrifugal force for gravity? You may as well just make a dinky modular one then!"

The "tesseract" in the sequel does, amazingly, actually behave like a tesseract in a scene or two.
You know that Arkenstone had a tesseract shape.
when all you cna think of is NASA
When realise that the Mad Scientists in movies are actually the good guys.
When you realise that actually they are the only not mad persons there.

When you watch Interstellar and when it gets to the part where they're orbiting Saturn, you think, "how is the crew not dying from the extreme radiation? It's said in that same scene that the Endurance's hull is only a few millimeters of aluminum, which is completely insufficient for the extreme radiation effects," rather than questioning the other more prominent inaccuracies of the movie.
Think positive: they would not die from the Saturn radiation, because they would be dead from the Solar and galactic ones long before.
You go to model a small stunt plane and find yourself trying to build an Antonov 225.
When you start  building Saturn from collecting hoola-hoops for its rings.
When you make a model of Venus that is accurate right down to the toxic atmosphere.
When you smell like Io.
when you cn hear this picture

When youre tempted to argue star names to ban folk
